page.title: 03Risby Poor's Heath 2
page.content:
Lifelong Resident: "I remember them big old rotary ploughs coming to the Heath.We used to go out there and watch them.Big as this classroom they were and they used to grind round and round in the ground and get down really deep. And the rabbits-you should have seen them run."
"Roger G. farms it now.His dad had the Heath ploughed.Fords used to try out their tractors as a demonstration to local farmers.They used to come to see them in action and that way he got it all ploughed.He was a good farmer.See the corn there now."
